required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Homeopathic Cold Remedy for Children Study
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of a Homeopathic Cold Remedy for Children

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized controlled trial of a commercially available homeopathic cold remedy will be conducted. A total of 400 children, 2-5 years old, diagnosed with an upper respiratory tract infection will be randomized to receive either the homeopathic remedy or placebo. Parents of study children will administer 5 ml of the study medication up to 6 times per day as needed to treat cold symptoms. One hour after giving a dose the parent will rate change in symptoms (for up to the first 10 doses). In addition, parents will rate their child's overall symptom severity and functional status over the first 3 days of the cold. It is postulated that children receiving the active homeopathic remedy will have better symptom relief and that their symptom severity and functional status will improve more rapidly than those receiving placebo.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Severity of Cold Symptoms
primary_outcome.time_frame: Parents assessed change in symptom 1 hour after a dose of study medication
primary_outcome.description: Parents measured change in runny nose, cough, nasal congestion and sneezing severity one hour after administering a dose of study medication up to the first 10 doses of study medication. Change in symptom rated from 0 to 6, with 0 indicative of the symptom being much worse and 6 indicative of the symptom being much improved. The unit of analysis for each outcome was doses of medication. Each participant could contribute data on 0 - 10 doses.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Parents assessed change in symptom 1 hour after dose of study medication
secondary_outcome.description: Parents measured change in severity of irritability, lethargy, fussiness, and appetite one hour after administering a dose of study medication up to the first 10 doses of study medication. Change in symptom rated from 0 to 6, with 0 indicative of the symptom being much worse and 6 indicative of the symptom being much improved. The unit of analysis for each outcome was doses of medication. Each participant could contribute data on 0 - 10 doses.

Change in functional status of child during the 7-10 days after the index visit for an upper respiratory tract infection. Parents rated 5 activities (vigorous activity, activities that require concentration, activities with family or friends, appetite and sleep) daily for 3 days in their child and again at the 7-10 day follow-up. Functional status scores range from 0 to 15, with higher scores indicative of better functional status.

Change in health status of child during the 7-10 days after the index visit for an upper respiratory tract infection. Parents rated health status on 1-10 scale with 1 indicating perfect health and 10 indicating very sick. Health status rated on first 3 days of study and again at the 7-10 day follow-up

Change in cold symptoms of child during the 7-10 days after the index visit for an upper respiratory tract infection. Parents assessed severity of runny nose, cough, sneeze and congestion in their child using a 0-3 scale for each symptom, 0=none to 3= severe. Cold score is sum of scores for each symptom. Parents assessed cold score twice daily on study days 1-3 and at the 7-10 day follow-up

arm_group.description: 5 ml of homeopathic cold remedy given by mouth up to 6 times per day as needed for cold symptoms
5 ml of placebo given by mouth up to 6 times per day as needed for cold symptoms

intervention.description: 5 ml PO q4h prn cold symptoms
liquid made to look like the active homeopathic remedy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- clinical diagnosis of upper respiratory tract infection
- duration of symptoms < 7 days
- Parent who speaks English
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of asthma
- on any prescribed medication
- prescribed any medication other than acetaminophen or ibuprofen at index visit
- use of homeopathic remedy within 48 hours of index visit

facility.name: University of Washington Medical Center- Roosevelt Pediatric Care Center

group.title: Homeopathic Cold Remedy
group.description: 5 ml of homeopathic cold remedy given by mouth up to 6 times per day as needed for cold symptoms Hyland's Cold 'n Cough 4 kids: 5 ml PO q4h prn cold symptoms

group.title: Placebo
group.description: 5 ml of placebo given by mouth up to 6 times per day as needed for cold symptoms placebo: liquid made to look like the active homeopathic remedy

participants_list.participants: Completed defined as participants who completed telephone follow-up at end of study period
Completed defined as participants who completed telephone follow-up at end of study period

baseline.population: Eligible patients enrolled. Age data were analyzed on 127 participants in the placebo group since exact data were missing for 2 participants

group.title: Homeopathic Cold Remedy
group.description: 5 ml of homeopathic cold remedy given by mouth up to 6 times per day as needed for cold symptoms Hyland's Cold 'n Cough 4 kids: 5 ml PO q4h prn cold symptoms

group.title: Placebo
group.description: 5 ml of placebo given by mouth up to 6 times per day as needed for cold symptoms placebo: liquid made to look like the active homeopathic remedy

measure.title: Age
measure.description: exact age information missing on 2 participants in placebo group, noted to be 2-5 years old

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: Gender information missing on 1 participant randomized to the homeopathic cold remedy group

measure.title: baseline cold symptom score
measure.description: sum of scores for runny nose severity, sneeze severity, cough severity and congestion severity rated by parent at study entry. For each symptom, possible scores range from 0 to 3, with 3 indicating most severe. Baseline cold score missing on 1 participant in the homeopathic cold remedy group

outcome.title: Change in Severity of Cold Symptoms
outcome.description: Parents measured change in runny nose, cough, nasal congestion and sneezing severity one hour after administering a dose of study medication up to the first 10 doses of study medication. Change in symptom rated from 0 to 6, with 0 indicative of the symptom being much worse and 6 indicative of the symptom being much improved. The unit of analysis for each outcome was doses of medication. Each participant could contribute data on 0 - 10 doses.
outcome.time_frame: Parents assessed change in symptom 1 hour after a dose of study medication
outcome.population: Data are from logbooks returned by participants. For each participant, data on response to up to 10 doses were collected. Not every symptom was present at each dose. Change in runny nose assessed after 819 doses, sneeze 456 doses, cough 772 doses, congestion 845. For category title, first n= homeopathic cold remedy, second n= placebo.

analysis.method_desc: generalized estimating equations used to account for multiple doses in same participant
generalized estimating equations used to account for multiple doses in single participant

outcome.title: Functional Status
outcome.description: Change in functional status of child during the 7-10 days after the index visit for an upper respiratory tract infection. Parents rated 5 activities (vigorous activity, activities that require concentration, activities with family or friends, appetite and sleep) daily for 3 days in their child and again at the 7-10 day follow-up. Functional status scores range from 0 to 15, with higher scores indicative of better functional status.
outcome.population: Participants who completed follow-up and had valid data for functional outcome. Data on functional status analyzed on days 1-3 for participants who returned symptom diaries including 145 on day 1, 142 on day 2 and 130 on day 3. For category title, first n= homeopathic cold remedy, second n= placebo.

group.title: Homeopathic Cold Remedy
group.description: 5 ml of homeopathic cold remedy given by mouth up to 6 times per day as needed for cold symptoms Hyland's Cold 'n Cough 4 kids: 5 ml PO q4h prn cold symptoms

group.title: Placebo
group.description: 5 ml of placebo given by mouth up to 6 times per day as needed for cold symptoms placebo: liquid made to look like the active homeopathic remedy

measure.title: Functional Status
measure.description: Change in functional status of child during the 7-10 days after the index visit for an upper respiratory tract infection. Parents rated 5 activities (vigorous activity, activities that require concentration, activities with family or friends, appetite and sleep) daily for 3 days in their child and again at the 7-10 day follow-up. Functional status scores range from 0 to 15, with higher scores indicative of better functional status.
measure.population: Participants who completed follow-up and had valid data for functional outcome. Data on functional status analyzed on days 1-3 for participants who returned symptom diaries including 145 on day 1, 142 on day 2 and 130 on day 3. For category title, first n= homeopathic cold remedy, second n= placebo.

outcome.title: Health Status
outcome.description: Change in health status of child during the 7-10 days after the index visit for an upper respiratory tract infection. Parents rated health status on 1-10 scale with 1 indicating perfect health and 10 indicating very sick. Health status rated on first 3 days of study and again at the 7-10 day follow-up
outcome.population: Health status on those with follow-up data and a valid score for health status. Health status also assessed in participants who returned symptom diaries including 152 on day 1, 142 on day 2 and 132 on day 3. For category title, first n= homeopathic cold remedy, second n= placebo.

group.title: Homeopathic Cold Remedy
group.description: 5 ml of homeopathic cold remedy given by mouth up to 6 times per day as needed for cold symptoms Hyland's Cold 'n Cough 4 kids: 5 ml PO q4h prn cold symptoms

group.title: Placebo
group.description: 5 ml of placebo given by mouth up to 6 times per day as needed for cold symptoms placebo: liquid made to look like the active homeopathic remedy

measure.title: Health Status
measure.description: Change in health status of child during the 7-10 days after the index visit for an upper respiratory tract infection. Parents rated health status on 1-10 scale with 1 indicating perfect health and 10 indicating very sick. Health status rated on first 3 days of study and again at the 7-10 day follow-up
measure.population: Health status on those with follow-up data and a valid score for health status. Health status also assessed in participants who returned symptom diaries including 152 on day 1, 142 on day 2 and 132 on day 3. For category title, first n= homeopathic cold remedy, second n= placebo.

outcome.title: Overall Symptom Severity
outcome.description: Change in cold symptoms of child during the 7-10 days after the index visit for an upper respiratory tract infection. Parents assessed severity of runny nose, cough, sneeze and congestion in their child using a 0-3 scale for each symptom, 0=none to 3= severe. Cold score is sum of scores for each symptom. Parents assessed cold score twice daily on study days 1-3 and at the 7-10 day follow-up
outcome.population: Data analyzed on participant who completed 7-10 day follow-up and had valid cold scores. Data also analyzed twice daily on those participants who returned symptom diaries including: day 1 (153, 148), day 2 (146,138), and day 3 (136, 126). For category title, first n= homeopathic cold remedy, second n= placebo.

measure.description: Change in cold symptoms of child during the 7-10 days after the index visit for an upper respiratory tract infection. Parents assessed severity of runny nose, cough, sneeze and congestion in their child using a 0-3 scale for each symptom, 0=none to 3= severe. Cold score is sum of scores for each symptom. Parents assessed cold score twice daily on study days 1-3 and at the 7-10 day follow-up
measure.population: Data analyzed on participant who completed 7-10 day follow-up and had valid cold scores. Data also analyzed twice daily on those participants who returned symptom diaries including: day 1 (153, 148), day 2 (146,138), and day 3 (136, 126). For category title, first n= homeopathic cold remedy, second n= placebo.

reported_events.time_frame: Data were collected during the study period and at the follow-up phone call scheduled 7-10 days after enrollment
reported_events.desc: Parents were asked to record any side effects after each dose of study medications. Parents also asked about side effects during follow-up phone call.

group.title: Homeopathic Cold Remedy
group.description: 5 ml of homeopathic cold remedy given by mouth up to 6 times per day as needed for cold symptoms Hyland's Cold 'n Cough 4 kids: 5 ml PO q4h prn cold symptoms

group.title: Placebo

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
